numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The question is: Is it worth being optimistic or pessimistic?
2. Humankind has a progressive journey.
3. Humankind aims to construct a utopian civilization.
4. It is important to research investigations and findings.
5. It is important to highlight investigations and findings.
6. The purpose is to determine the achievement of the dream.
7. An individual can be conscious about the significance of the past situation of the world.
8. An individual can be conscious about the significance of the present situation of the world.
9. An individual can be conscious about the significance of the future situation of the world.
10. An individual can be conscious about possible outcomes of the passing of time on the life of the individual.
11. Sufficient data is a precise way to determine if an opinion can be supported.
12. Concise data is a precise way to determine if an opinion can be reevaluated.
13. I interpret the aim of the graph.
14. The graph aims to establish a clear comparison.
15. The comparison is between opinions of two significantly different age ranges.
16. The two age ranges are related.
17. The topic is important.
18. The topic is relevant nowadays.
19. The graph aims to enable further discussions about the data.
20. The topic is the effectiveness of a perceived completion.
21. The topic is the overall accomplishment of the idea that the world situation gets better with each generation.
22. The data is presented in a scatter plot format.
23. The scatter plot has a progression line.
24. The scatter plot has a pattern.
25. The progression line suggests a positive correlation.
26. The pattern suggests a positive correlation.
27. The data is dispersed.
28. I identify that the correlation is not strong.
29. It is likely that the data has a higher standard deviation.
30. A higher standard deviation can affect a conclusion.
31. A conclusion can be prompt.
32. A conclusion can be erroneous.
33. An erroneous conclusion can determine that the data is unreliable.
34. The data comes from a survey.
35. The survey was conducted in more than 15 countries.
